page.title: 14Stagsden,St.Leonard's Church
page.content: The church,built of locally quarried stone, has a raised and circular churchyard which may indicate that it was a pre-christian site of worship.It is built in the Transitional period between Decorated and Perpendicular and has a ring of 6 bells. The fine quality of the organ is much prized today and recently the church has seen a number of concerts and organ recitals e.g. by the Bedfordshire Association of Organists and the Luton Police Choir.The organ was originally a barrel organ from St, Mary's Church, Bedford,was completely rebuilt on a gallery and electrified.All pipework from the former organ that had been voiced and regulated by the Rev. Bonavin-Hunt (a tonal expert) was used.
